source: CA DCC Cannabis Advertising Regulations — cannabis.ca.gov
notes: CA DCC rules largely mirror federal FTC standards for health claims. Health benefit claims explicitly prohibited.

rules.description: Medical claim: CA DCC prohibits any statement that implies cannabis treats, cures, or prevents any medical condition.
Health benefit claim: CA DCC explicitly prohibits the phrase 'health benefit(s)' in cannabis advertising without FDA approval.
Prescription language prohibited under CA Business and Professions Code §26152.
Clinical claim: implies regulatory approval or clinical validation not recognized for cannabis in CA.
Medical professional endorsement prohibited by CA DCC advertising rules.
Appeal to minors: CA law requires all advertising to be in media where 71.6%+ of audience is 21+. Child-directed imagery prohibited.
